description.raw:
A `disconnect()` call on a `zmq` socket can raise an ~~exception~~ assertion if the other side of the connection is already destroyed. This might happen if you have a fast publisher that publishes some data and then is destroyed right away.

How to test the patch?

* Compile this branch.
* Execute the following test a couple of times. It should **not** fail: 

```
#!c++

./test/integration/INTEGRATION_twoProcessesPubSub --gtest_filter=*FastPublisher*
```

* Save the test:

```
#!c++

cp ./test/integration/INTEGRATION_twoProcessesPubSub ~
```

* Compile  `ign-transport1` branch to reproduce the problem.
* Execute the test that you saved before a couple of times and it should eventually fail with an internal zmq assertion: 

```
#!c++

~/INTEGRATION_twoProcessesPubSub --gtest_filter=*FastPublisher*
```

* [Trusty](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/93/) :large_blue_circle:
* [Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/87/) :large_blue_circle:
* [Windows](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/177/) :large_blue_circle:
